resources.string: The game is played by teams of two or more people. The task of each player of the team is to explain as many words as possible on the screen, but in other words, using, for example, synonyms, antonyms and clues so that members of your team can guess as many words as possible before the time runs out. The more words the team guessed, the more points it will earn.

When explaining words, you can not mention any part of the word. You can use synonyms. You can also use antonyms as an alternative. You may not use foreign languages unless all players agree.\n\nThe guessed word must match exactly. The explaining player helps the guessers find the correct form of the word. If the word has two parts and someone guesses the first part, you can then use that part of the word in further explanation.

For each word guessed, the team receives one point. The team with the most points is considered the winner. If at the end of the last round the teams have the same number of points, then an additional round is held.
It\'s a party game! Therefore, you can agree among yourself and make the rules more flexible for yourself.
Enter a name for the set of words
At least two teams are required to play the game
The game is designed for 5 teams
Enter a description for the set
For example Set for a light party
A new set has been created
My team %1$s\ won the CosmoAlias with %2$d\ points
Are you sure you want to delete?
You have entered an invalid data range
Swipe to delete team\nClick to change name

This is a mobile version of the beloved Alias game. The goal of the players is to explain the word to teammates, without using gestures, pronouncing the hidden word and words with the same root. The team that guessed the most words at the end of all rounds wins.
